awd_titl_txt: 1992 Aspen Winter Elementary Particle Physics Conference;   January 12-18, 1992; Aspen, Colorado
awd_abstract_narration: This award will provide partial support of the eighth in                   a series of conferences in January at the Aspen Center.  These                  conferences are given in three areas of physics, and the                        present award covers the area of elementary particle physics.                   Conferences in this series accommodate about 65 physicists                      both experimentalists and theorists.  The focus for the                         conference this year will be both on the virtually massless                     particles called neutrinos and on the heaviest particles which                  are expected to accompany them in the theory called the                         "standard model" which has so far been successful in                            explaining the most fundamental aspects of the forces of                        nature.  Any evidence for failures of this theory will be                       explored in this conference.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
